title: Print, "Design for Upper Part of a Mirror and Chimney Piece", 1745
medium: Etching and engraving on off-white laid paper
inscribed: On plate, upper right: L.; above: Dessein d'un grand Chambranle de Cheminée; Ioint à celuij de son Couronnement.; center, on a horizontal strap dividing the image: Ce dessin ne fait voir que le haut, ét le bas de la Glace; on la feroit proprotionnée a sa largeur.; lower left, in the image: Le chambranle de cette Cheminée, ést/suppose être de marbre; ét les figures/chinoises, ét autres de bronse dorez.; lower left: Inventé par F. de Cuvilliés.; lower center: C.P.S.C.M.; lower right, in the image: Plan de la Tablette.; lower right: gravé par C.A. de Lespilliez/3.
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 80 and 81)
dimensions:
Platemark: 35.6 x 23.1 cm (14 x 9 1/8 in.)
Sheet: 44 x 28.6 cm (17 5/16 x 11 1/4 in.)
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Design for Upper Part of a Mirror and Chimney Piece", 1745.
1745. Etching and engraving on off-white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1921-6-285-61.
